page.title: 06East Hagbourne- homes survey
page.content: A survey conducted by the 1st yr of St. Birinus school, Didcot in East Hagbourne on a random sample of 48 properties showed 73% owner occupied, 10% privately rented and 17% council. The conclusions drawn from this survey showed that the private sector includes all the larger detached properties, some bungalows and semi-detached. Only the newer houses on the eastern side have gas heating, the others rely mainly on electricity. The distance from the shops is reflected in the high number of homes with freezers (83%) in which to store bulk purchases, and high car ownership. The older houses tend to have the largest gardens (up to 1/4 acre) and the most bedrooms, with more than one reception room. The council properties on the north west of the village are 2 bed maisonettes and 1 bed terraced bungalows
